com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy.Config

  • public class Config
extends Object
    Wraps the configuration file for Bukkit. "Knows how" to extract the parameters for the database.
    Author:
    ProgrammerDan

    • Method Detail

      • setupConfig

        public Config setupConfig(CivSpy plugin)

      • parseDatabase

        public Database parseDatabase()

      • getServer

        public String getServer()
        Which server are we running on? I could add BetterShards as a dependency, but for now just declare it.
        Returns:
        "local" or whatever is defined as server in config.

      • getAggregationPeriod

        public long getAggregationPeriod()
        How long to aggregate data into buckets before committing. A longer delay should not use much more memory then a shorter delay (due to aggregation effects) but does expose you to more data loss issues in case of shutdown.
        Returns:
        Default of 60,000 milliseconds, or whatever is defined as manager.aggregation_period in config.

      • getPeriodDelayCount

        public int getPeriodDelayCount()
        How many aggregation periods in the past do we hold on to, before we call it "done" and commit it to the database. A higher number ensures fewer stragglers are missed if we run into situations where sampler inflow starts to exceed outflow and "older" data winds up coming off the queue. Be careful with this; as this number increases the raw amount of data stored in memory continues to increase.
        Returns:
        Default of 6, or whatever is defined in config as manager.period_delay_count

      • getPeriodFutureCount

        public int getPeriodFutureCount()
        How many aggregation periods into the future do we pre-create? Recommend at least a few; this is to adjust for issues where the task to commit outgoing aggregation buckets falls behind, so that "current" (future from the perspective of the "stuck" queue) data isn't lost. This also speeds the actual transition from aggregation bucket to aggregation bucket.
        Returns:
        Default of 3, or whatever is defined in config as manager.period_future_count

      • getWorkerCount

        public int getWorkerCount()
        How many workers are taking data off the queue and pushing into aggregation bins? Due to some synchronization effects, don't pick too big a number; somewhere around 5 is probably more then enough.
        Returns:
        Default of 5, or whatever is defined in config as manager.worker_count

      • getFlowCaptureWindowCount

        public int getFlowCaptureWindowCount()
        How many "windows" do we keep to monitor and normalize in flow vs. out flow of DataSamples? Recommend 60.
        Returns:
        Default of 60, or whatever is defined in config as manager.flow_capture_window_count

      • getFlowCapturePeriod

        public long getFlowCapturePeriod()
        How big is each window we use to monitor and normalize in flow vs. out flow? Total monitoring / smoothing period is then window count * capture period. Typical to monitor about a minute's worth of inflow/outflow, but 10 minutes would be fine too; default total is 1 minute (60000 milliseconds).
        Returns:
        Default of 1000, or whatever is defined in config as manager.flow_capture_period

      • getSection

        public org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection getSection(Class<?> clazz)
        Used by autoloader, grabs a configuration section with the same simple name as the class passed in, or null if nothing found.
        Parameters:
        clazz - A Class to find a configuration section with the same name
        Returns:
        null if not found, the configuration section otherwise.
